item.title: About This Site
item.description: About This Site This isn’t anything like a tutorial or a comprehensive reference—it’s just a dump of some of the tools, resources, and thought-processes that went into building this site, in case it would be helpful to anyone. Fonts I went with Charter. I converted the XCharter OTF fonts to WOFF2, then base64-encoded them and baked them into my CSS. I went with XCharter rather than Bitstream Charter because it has an extended character set and more font variants—including small-caps, which I use for cross-references.

item.title: Whatâ€™s with the Hyperlinks?
item.description: What’s with the Hyperlinks? Readability above all—following Matthew Butterick’s example in his Practical Typography web book. One should be able to read the text from start to finish with minimal distractions. Do you know what I find distracting? Horrible blue underlined text. This is design 101: if you want people to notice something, just make it look disgusting. Styling links in this way is common. That might be all right if your webpage is a glorified link dump (nothing wrong with that).
